website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for the four-hour fast charging base.
pros: The flip up brush and the extendable crevice tool help make this vacuum flexible
Smart Charge technology allows for a better battery
Cyclonic action keeps the filter clean
Two attachments make this a flexible cleaning machine
cons: Users tell us it is very noisy
The position in which it sits on the charger seems precarious

website_summaries.verdict: While other cordless handheld vacuums lose suction power over time, this model maintains steady power to complete the job on one charge. Transparent collection bin is easy to maintain.
pros: Rechargeable lithium battery maintains steady power, no fade out
Onboard crevice and brush tools ideal for automotive use
Uses 50% less energy to recharge than other cordless vacuums
cons: Suction power and duration can be variable
Cannot be wall-mounted for easy recharging
Does not include an extension wand for deeper cleaning

website_summaries.verdict: A light and budget-friendly handheld vacuum from a reputable brand. Bag-free, which is a cost-saving and environmentally-friendly touch.
pros: The lithium-ion battery means this vac will outlast most of the competition
Comes with a two-year limited warranty
cons: As the battery goes down, so does the suction power

customer_reviews.title: B&D admits some chargers are defective
customer_reviews.text: Same issue as many other 1 star reviews. Some of the units' charger/battery seem to have major issues out of the gate. Mine lasted less than a week. After much arm twisting with the B&D rep, here is their official response after verifying the production date on my model: "We sell millions of these units per year and unfortunately, some did have charger issues. We have rectified it and sending replacements to customers that had the issue." Amazon -- you might want to make sure you're not sending out these defective units, and only those that have been "rectified." Hurts your rep if B&D isn't solving this directly with you, especially since it is an "Amazon Choice" product.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vacuum but battery has a short life and is not replaceable.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent hand vacuum and I am on our second one. But the reason I am on my second one is that the battery is not replaceable and dies after less than a year of regular use. This is a major fault in design (or design on purpose?). I would recommend another brand if you can find one with a replaceable battery. There are videos online for how to remove and replace the battery with a suitable battery pack. But this requires wiring and soldering skills. It also dangerous if done wrong which could lead to a fire and voids the manufacturer's warranty.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by his debonair looks. This cat is a litter flinger. It's like his personal feline mission to send litter particles into outer space. Because the ultralight cat litter really flies, I buy the old school heavy kind. This hand vac sucks it all up, too. It's dedicated specifically to litter in my house because using it anywhere else would be gross. So for cat litter, a win.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Momma

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum, BUT...BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works great out of the box. Bought it in March 2017. We use it every single day to spot clean, roughly 2-5 minutes per day. Around June 2018, the battery started showing signs of not holding the charge. Now (Sep 2018) the vacuum will run less than one minute on a full charge. BATTERY IS NOT REPLACEABLE. I hate to make this vacuum another land fill item. This is the trend with manufacturers and consumers at this day and age. The planet's resources will not maintain this type of life style much longer (10 more generations, maybe).
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Lapinski

customer_reviews.title: The little vacuum that could... couldn't
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE - 13 months later and it won't charge its completely DEAD. The blue light stays solid but the vacuum won't turn on. Trying to email customer support but their website doesn't load properly on my Mac. Will have to wait until Monday to call. Love this little guy. I use it every day for household needs or my car. The brush attachment helps clean the crevices in my couch, the skinny nozzle gets the hard to reach places in my car. The charge lasts long enough for us and the suction hasn't wavered. I have two messy toddlers, and a cat and this cleans up after them. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart and dies
customer_reviews.text: This can be taken apart I two different sections. The front piece of this detaches frequently on its own ( it appears to be locked but will pop off when vacuuming) which is frustrating. Secondly, I have had this for 5 months and now it just shuts off after a couple of minutes. It doesn't gradually die, it's sudden death. I just took it off the charger this morning and vacuumed for 2 minutes and it turned itself off.
customer_reviews.author: SF Green

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this item 3 years ago. It no longer works. It doesn’t hold a charge and it has no suction. Now I know what you’re thinking. Three years? You’re coming here to review a product after 3 years. Yes, I am. Because I’m honestly a bit tired of everything being disposable. When my parents bought an appliance, no matter how small, they kept it for DECADES! And it would WORK for decades! I’m sorry, but a small appliance shouldn’t be useless after 3 years. I can still use my mom’s percolator from the 80s, and I’m pretty sure my dad had his vacuum just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Short life span, apparently.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product about ten months and it has already quit working. It's charges...shows full charge, but will not turn on! Besides that, the item had been amazing. I have to cats and it cuts way back in cleaning time and effort. I wish the battery life was better. It seems to only last about 20 mins at most. It does have a fairly fast charge time though. *update* I emailed black and Decker customer service about my issue last night. I already got a response that they sent me a replacement! I Must say, that was more than acceptable. I anticipated weeks of fighting and more weeks of waiting. I am thoroughly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Rakkasan

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Vaccum Well AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: At first it seems the vaccum worked OK (not great). I’ve routinely cleaned the filter and emptied it. The other day I was trying to vacuum up little wood chips and they would suck in, but as soon as I pulled the unit up to do something else, the pieces fell out. It’s suction power is TERRIBLE and it gets bad quickly. Do not wast your money. I don’t know if any good ones on the market right now, but I got a corded Armor All unit that sucks the **** out of my car and everything else. Just by a corded one and deal with the cord issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the worst hand vacuum I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst hand vacuum I've ever owned. Not enough suction for bird seed on the floor, crumbs in the couch cushions, etc. Charge does not hold longer than 10 minutes before it gets weaker (if that is possible). Parts don't fit together well, and sometimes comes apart during use. The unit does not fit snugly on charger, and the telescoping attachment even makes the suction worse. This is the most poorly designed and made hand vac I have ever used. Too bad it costs so much!
customer_reviews.author: Fauxgoddess

customer_reviews.title: Great tool; but battery doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2/2017 and was extremely satisfied until about a month ago when the rechargeable battery wouldn’t hold a charge for longer than a few minutes. It seems that this short duration battery life is pretty universal with this B & D unit. Really need to replace this unit but reluctant to do so with another B & D product.
customer_reviews.author: Cape Cod Nana

customer_reviews.title: Missing filters
customer_reviews.text: I've had the vacuum a week and at first was really impressed with the suction power. After a couple uses I realized it was much louder than before and after reading the manual, I noticed mine never came with the plastic or cloth filters! So all the dust and little objects the vacuum picked up was sucked right into the motor, causing it to run loud and it's impossible to dissemble without breaking it. I am assuming this is some sort of safety/fire issue when in use so I'm not risking using it again. I'm returning the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: ALester

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum sucks in all the wrong ways
customer_reviews.text: We recenty bought a Roomba, which meant that with the exception of spot cleaning the furniture, we no longer needed our upright vacuum. So, I bought this in hopes of being able to get rid of the larger vac and instead rely on this handheld and our Roomba. Boy was I wrong. This thing sucks in all the wrong ways. There is not enough suction to remove pet hair on fabric. I scrubbed and held the vacuum on top hoping to create suction. Nada. Finally, I picked at the fur with my fingers then removed it with the vacuum. Way too much work. I sent it back. The upright stays.
customer_reviews.author: Terra Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good little Helper
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand some of these reviews about the battery. I leave mine unplugged and it remains charged for months. I only plug in until charged then unplug. I use it for the little pigs..sorry husband and kids that live here. It does a pretty good job. Crumbs, light weight dust, cat litter clean up. The stairs without carpet does okay but carpet, the floor vacuum hands down...sorry. Tried to use in the car...not so much, but other light jobs it does great. Love that it empties out easy...specially if you have to retrieve an opps. The suction could be better, but not the worst. It is very easy to use. It is defently a great mom helper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not like
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews before purchasing this vacuum after our old one finally broke. I have owned for over six months and just don't like this vacuum for two reasons. I don't like that there is no warning when this needs to be charged like the non lithium where the sound would change and you knew you only had a few more minutes. But my biggest gripe is that the front arm piece doesn't stay on and is constantly falling off while vacuuming thus dropping the dirt back onto the floor. I have finally duct taped it back on but I think it is a huge flaw. Perhaps only mine has this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Strike 3. You’re out.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd B&D vaccine I’ve owned. The first (this model) lasted from Feb - Oct. 2017. The battery on that one went out. The second vacuum I bought was a higher end black and decker (the black one that swivels in the middle). It lasted from October 2017 - Feb 2019. It too died of battery problems. We figured the cheeper one almost lasted as long so we came back to this model and bought our second of this model. It has now lasted from feb 2019 - July 2019. This one died of mother burnout. It’s making a loud noise and smelling like burning rubber every time we run it. That’s it. I quit.
customer_reviews.author: ailsa lewis

customer_reviews.title: Charger Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is extremely handy, and I must say that it has made my life easier by not having to plug in my Dyson every time my children bring sand in with their shoes. My youngest especially loves being able to use it to help me when cleaning up rooms or my car. The only problem is that the charging base burnt out. In my opinion this negates the helpful lithium battery, especially since a replacement costs half as much as I paid for the entire unit. This is the reason I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kary C

customer_reviews.title: Battery Dead after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little hand vac for my laundry room area. We have dogs, so that area gets coated in fur each time we load the washer. The vac was super handy for a while and helped me stay on top of messes, but around year 2 is when I noticed the battery starting to degrade. I've had it for around 4 years now, and it'll only run for 15 seconds or so after a full charge. I try to prevent / reduce as much waste as possible in my home. I wish products could be made better so we only have to buy them once! Not looking forward to trying to figure out how to recycle this thing.
customer_reviews.author: widdi265

customer_reviews.title: Insanely good
customer_reviews.text: This is insanely amazing. I didn’t know a handheld vacuum existed that was this good. I spilled a whole bottle of pepper in a pull out spice cabinet and had no clue how I would ever get it all out from back in the molding... this little guy saved the day. I’ve been using it to dust blinds, the car, drawers, window ledges. It’s seriously an incredible amount of sucking power. Stays charged long enough for any of the small jobs I’ve had. I’ve not tested it long enough to see how long it stays charged. Even if this little guy doesn’t last but a couple months I would repurchase. It’s THAT good.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: it's pretty incredible. If you are looking for a cordless ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple months and I have to say, it's pretty incredible. If you are looking for a cordless vac that has real suction and lasts longer than 20 minutes, you'll be disappointed but if you want something that can handle quick jobs or suck up the dog hair on the stairs this is your friend. It stores neatly in an upright position that I easily hide behind a plant in the dining room. It has accessories that are all neatly tucked into the unit and don't require fishing out of a cabinet. It is easy to empty and charges quickly. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: obiwan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: It worked wonderfully for 2 years, and as soon as the 2-year warranty expired, it began failing to keep its charge for longer than one second. Literally, turns on and turns back off again. I called customer service, who informed me that there is nothing that can be done because the warranty expired. There are MANY other reviews with this problem - believe them!! Do not waste your money! Such a disappointment. What a waste of money. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery life, pointless
customer_reviews.text: Terribly disappointed. The suction is not incredible, it's pretty average. The battery only lasts 10-15 minutes after a full charge. I couldn't finish vacuuming a sedan. Not what I expected from the reviews, and actually bad enough I am going to return this. Customer service from Black and Decker sucked. I wrote to then and their support was essentially "The battery lasts 15 mins max, if you don't like it that sucks. Return from where you got it". I only now realize that the life between charges isn't advertised. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: suzyq85

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and sucks up any mess
customer_reviews.text: My sister had one of these for her house because she vacuums up the cat hairs on her couch. I had to buy one too and make sure you charge it before you use it. The blue light will shut off whenever it’s fully charged. It’s very powerful and I even used it not only for cat hair on the couch but for vacuuming out my car. My daughter had spilled her crackers and cookies all over the floor and used it to clean up the mess. Very durable and you can install it on something or on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lacy Mead

customer_reviews.title: Battery issues NOT resolved. Horrible product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor excuse for a product. The battery life lasts 5 to 7 minutes regardless if it 9 has charged for a day or a week. I can't even complete a quick vacuum of my car before it runs out of power. I had seen the the reviews regarding poor battery life but most of these reviews were dated. Other more recent reviews claimed they had fixed the battery issue. This couldn't be further from the truth. I purchased this product 2/11/20. For a company like Black and Decker to sell a product with such poor quality is a shame. This product is so bad I won't consider any of their products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Alan

customer_reviews.title: Good looking & Powerful ~
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dustbuster ! I have been a faithful Black & Decker user for decades. It's easy to empty, easy to clean, has a brush that is attached (moves back when you want) and has a sleek, modern look. PROBLEM: This is difficult to put back on the stand. Takes several tries before it "grabs" the charging metal and a light comes one when you have it connected correctly. Not sure why this design is so difficult but I sure wish I had a different option for connection.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: love the charging base but top part can break off easily
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these we've owned and seems like the only one that charges fast with a base that you just sit it on. However the top part unscrews when you empty to clean it out and to screw it back on there are two little notches that are plastic that broke on our first on immediately and are compromised on this new one already. May have to duck tape this one together too - but i'll keep it as the suction power is great and the charging base is the real selling point.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: We were so pleased with it we purchased two more as gifts and the recipients were thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: This little hand vac is amazing! The charge lasts a very long time! It is easy to clean/empty and easy to just drop in the charger. The suction power is awesome and the motor holds its power and doesn't slow down when the battery is low, but rather just stops. It is okay for stairs but I like a larger coverage when doing my carpeted stairs. We've had it several months with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Wingert

customer_reviews.title: Great value and works well
customer_reviews.text: We really needed a cordless vacuum as we have 4 cats that leave hair and litter all over if given half a chance. I generally like B & D for the quality and price so I bought this one. It picks up an embarrassingly large amount of debris. Enough suction to get cat hair and litter, and the nozzle turns so it can get into lots of different spaces. The bad reviews indicated the battery doesn't last long enough and then the whole thing has to be replaced because you can't replace the battery. Mine is still pretty new so it still works great, but I will certainly amend the review if it dies prematurely!
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Very Noisy!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Dust Buster with this new version and I am very disappointed. It puts out a very high frequency screaming noise that is extremely irritating. The narrow spout with a brush is no better at picking up things then the old version. It does not have a wall mount and must be stood upright on a counter. The only redeeming quality is a better battery that lasts longer but after a few seconds the noise gives you a headache. UPDATE- After several months the battery no longer holds a charge. The battery is NOT replaceable so I have to trash it!! Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Appell

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Was leary on purchase, dust busters are just not what they used to be, I'm only 33 but the quality used to be way better. My wife and I bought one a few years back and hardly used it. Hard to charge, suction was crap and you had to remove from power to avoid destroying the battery to over charge. This one has brought some faith back! It is a tad loud but this thing is great. Great suction and it just sits in the charger. The filter cover is a bit small so a few clogs happen but overall we are really happy with this. If you don't want to drop hundreds on over priced hand helds, get this
customer_reviews.author: ZFAM

customer_reviews.title: Cannot wall mount and charge.
customer_reviews.text: Instruction manual says a wall mount is included in the package but it is not included. The only way to charge the unit is on a circular base so the unit must sit on a countertop somewhere. I don't know why anybody would design and produce a product like this that is not wall mountable and chargeable. Everything that I have ever bought made by Black and Decker has been junk and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: retrade

customer_reviews.title: Two years later—won’t take a charge.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum worked well when new. I liked it for doing a quick cleaning of my car or picking up crumbs my toddlers perpetually drop. Eventually the clips that hold on the dust bin weakened to the point it would just fall off and dump its contents on the floor (the nozzle is the dust bin cover). That was annoying, but I just got used to not being able to apply any pressure to the tip. Now, 2 years and 3 months since I bought it, the battery is shot. Even after charging overnight, it only runs for about 30 seconds before it dies. Unfortunately, I can not recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: QuantumBrewer

customer_reviews.title: Battery dies, not replaceable
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little vacuum for us for over 3 years. It wasn't used heavily, but it came in handy often around the house. Then after 3+ years the battery gave out, like other reviewers mentioned, and unfortunately, we too discovered there's nothing we can do about it. Now it feels like a waste to have a product that is otherwise in great condition. I trusted the Black+Decker name before, but not this time. I don't like to buy products for only a few years, I had hoped this one would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Cefalu

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF GARBAGE, DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this item is so highly rated. Being a sucker, I bought a second one after my first one completely crapped out prematurely, thinking it was a fluke. It was not. My second one has also crapped out after 2.5 years, conveniently just beyond the warranty. Called the 800 number for support, received recorded message saying they weren't taking calls. Tried online chat, was disconnected before even reaching a representative. Tried emailing, received "error" message after submitting instructing me to try again another time. WHAT?????????????? DO. NOT. PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Possible poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to help clean the slider tracks at the bottom section of the tall windows at home. The vacuum ran for a very few minutes and stopped. I read through the troubleshooting section of the manual and decided the filter must have been clogged. Following the manual's instructions, I removed the 2 filters, and cleaned and reinstalled them in the vacuum. (There was hardly any debris in either filter.) I vacuumed for less than a minute and it stopped again. My husband is going through the troubleshooting section of the owners' manual now. I'm thinking this vacuum is not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Durable and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this Black and Decker hand held vacuum.The 16v battery provides alot of power. The fully charged battery lasts a long time. I hang it in my laundry room which is a bit narrow. I have knocked it off the wall where it hangs twice and it landed on the tile floor. It came apart in 4 pieces but didn’t break. I was able to put it back together and it works fine. I was impressed. It’s definitely worth the money. I expect to have it a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Got it for pest control
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've got to admit, I didn't purchase this for carpet or cleaning up dog hair. I have a boxelder bug problem on my organic farm and organic pesticides don't work on them. So, as a last ditch effort, I got this bad boy to suck up the nymphs and deposit them into my pond (the mosquito fish love eating them!). This thing works like a charm! It has great suction power, doesn't seem to get clogged, holds a long charge and recharges quickly too! I'm very pleased with the product and it seems to be taking care of my pest problem too!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Passow

customer_reviews.title: Fathers "BEST GIFT EVER"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father to use in his RV several years ago. To this day he raves to everyone in the campsite about the lithium battery and the "suction power on this bad boy" It's dad approved. I say purchase it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Herzfeld

customer_reviews.title: Works great when new!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 of these so far and every one of them has suffered from short battery life. This happens after about a year or so. Light use. The unit would be great if it would last. Have two that last about a minute then shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: Plav

customer_reviews.title: Short useful life before batteries die and its garbage
customer_reviews.text: Initially a good product. However, for whatever reason the batteries used do not last much if any longer than the 2 year warranty period. Once the batteries go then it will not hold a charge and it is useless because the batteries cannot be easily replaced. Do not recommend due to the effectively short life of the product. If your willing to replace the item after about two years then this is a good item. I am not and feel that the batteries should be easily replaceable, thus the poor review.
customer_reviews.author: FGOrr

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of sucking power to pick up sand in our RV. CHARGING BASE IS OF THE WORST DESIGN. A KNAT COULD KNOCK IT OFF. Our previous vacuum (B&D)had a wall mountable base that the unit hung from. They always stop using designs THAT WORK so you buy more! Not sure of battery life, as we took it out our camper. It falls over from the movement of the camper when you walk around. Definitely would not buy again, or recommend this unit. If you plan on leaving this on some solid foundation, it might be ok. It is just too easy to knock it off the base.
customer_reviews.author: TMBarbier

customer_reviews.title: OK, it works fine, but...
customer_reviews.text: It sits on the charger but is barely stable. Not really comfy with it unless stuck back somewhere where you can accidentally knock it off the stand have it tumble to the floor. Ambiguous but it does not include a wall bracket. So, the manual is downstairs so I go to BD website and click on the download the manual. Nope, the link takes you to a third party service site. When you click on "Black and Decker" on that site it takes you back to the BD website that sent you there. Why make it hard to see the manual? Inexplicable. Dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mintz

customer_reviews.title: Won't suck up little bitty pebbles from shoes tracking into house!
customer_reviews.text: This is good for small jobs. Battery doesn't last long. Most powerful during first 5 minutes, but still won't pick up little pebbles from tennis shoe soles leaving them all over in the house. We have gravel pea pebbles in our driveway. Any shoe with good tread picks up pebbles. We try to leave shoes off at door, but not always possible. So? Every time you walk & bend that shoe, out comes the pebbles. The whole reason I bought this Black & Decker was mainly to suck up all those pebbles inbetween vacuuming. Plus sucking up ladybugs inbetween back windows of cars where window meets the carpet. (Fushion) Doesn't work for either. Back to searching.............. e
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mc

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Gotta splurge for better results.
customer_reviews.text: The best part about this thing is that it is cordless. But its no better than the cheap dirt devil I bought last year. Guess I need to pay even more to get something that will really suck up dirt huh. Sigh. Major disappointment. All i needed was something to clean the stairs. It picked stuff up but im def not gonna call them "clean". Even at full power conpletely empty it doesnt clean much just gets pet fur trapped in the brush i rip it off the brush and let it suck up the remainder. Meh. 2 stars. We gotta just spend a lotta money people for something that works. We tried right.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Three and a half stars, needs work
customer_reviews.text: This is a good vacuum, but it needs improvement. Pros: good suction power, good battery (a year and a half in with daily use) Cons: it falls apart while you're using it and you end up with a mess. This probably happens once a week and I've gotten really frustrated with this problem. Also, it's LOUD. If you have small children, they'll probably be covering their ears. I can barely stand the high pitched sound of this vacuum. I also wish the brush was more durable. It's all worn down and basically useless now. I would love to try an updated and improved version of this little vacuum. Two kids, tons of crumbs, send help!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This hand vacuum was great while it worked, but it stopped working in three months. We bought it in July 2019, and by October it had zero charge and would not turn on. Supposedly it has a two year warranty, but there is no service center that works on consumer products anywhere near us, so in effect there is zero warranty.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Reader

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I have had a cheaper model of Black and Decker Cordless Vacuum and it was a pitiful disaster. Then I read a review of the this model is amazing. I mainly use it for cleaning out the floor mats of my SUV and other hard to reach places, I love, love love it. The suction power is unbelievable. I recommended it to my daughter who bought one also. This is an excellent dustbuster.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Karshner

customer_reviews.title: It really does suck
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a defective product or it got worse over time faster than a german car with an owner who avoids the maintenance schedule like the plague. The filter is empty, the dust bin section is empty but it can't even suck up dust bunnies... not sure if I can trust the newer model of this product if it wears out so fast. not sure what I can do besides send this unit to the recycling bin now. It still powers on, it still has some air going into the unit, but there's no suction
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in awhile
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this vacuum maybe 24 hours and used it like 8 times. It’s easy empty, charges fast, light, and cleans up everything. My only disappointment is I didn’t buy it sooner and no one told me when you reach your 40’s you start becoming way to happy over something as simple as this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to clean car interior but we use it more for cleaning up mess at home. Kids make crumbs all the time so for little spot cleaning this is perfectly handy. The only thing that I don't like is that it is way too noisy. The sound is way too loud that it sounds like a blower. Suction power is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Batteries charge for 1 year and then quit charging
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to work well, and worked well to vacuum up pet hair and cat litter. But as others have said, you need to take three parts apart to clean it properly. I could have lived with that. The reason I am giving it such a low review is that 1 year later, the battery won't charge. I can't find out where to get replacement batteries, and so I'm going to have to replace it. That's $50 down the drain, or I guess I paid $50 to use this for a year. Black and Decker is contributing to the trash heap our world is becoming by making units that don't last. I'll never buy a Black and Decker appliance again.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I have had this vacuum about a year and loved it. Suction was great, easy to clean and worked great in my car and furniture. That said, I wish I had listened to the reviews because as much as this vacuum cost I expected it to last a lot longer than just a year. It won't hold a charge anymore and is completely useless. You cannot replace the battery either so in the garbage it goes!
customer_reviews.author: G. cuba

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a returned vac missing wall mount
customer_reviews.text: Carton obviously opened before. Missing the wall mount, but won't return for that since I don't want to wall mount. However, I have purchsed several of these from Black and Decker since they began manufacturing them and this one is not as good except for the best suction. Having the base makes the vac lighter, but it takes up more room on the floor or earth and I don't think the base will last the full two years under the warranty. The base works now, so I'll keep it.
customer_reviews.author: MKR

customer_reviews.title: Works great on small debris and very strong suction
customer_reviews.text: The suction is great! I also had the previous model and I like the external filter that this one has. It works much better on preventing sand and small pieces of cat litter from going into the motor. But... like the previous model, sometimes the door flap that’s between the hose and the holding container sometimes gets stuck open... and since it’s made to hang upside down for storage, the debris that you just suctioned falls out. But it’s the best one for the price and I’m a fan for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Whetsell

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Bad Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on this is awful. At a full charge it didn't last more than 15 minutes. Took over 4 hours to charge fully when I first brought it home. The suction wasn't powerful enough to warrant this kind of loss in power. I am extremely unhappy with this product. I will be returning. I gave it two stars because it's lightweight and dexterous. If you're looking for something that will clean up things quick and easy in a couple minutes, it's probably fine for that, but it can't clean out a car or do a full flight of stairs in one charge.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Need a return label -- not something to take to UPS
customer_reviews.text: This is undoubtedly the worst purchase I've ever made and I'm 78 years old. It doesn't pick up anything at all. I wanted to use it on the floor of my car where some sand had been tracked in. It won't pick up anything. I would love to return it but the trash man has taken the box. So..... unless there is another way to return it, I'm just going to trash it. Was not worth taking the time to open the box. Please do not buy......
customer_reviews.author: Jan T.

customer_reviews.title: Most powerful
customer_reviews.text: It’s good, power is better than most. I have 2 dogs so the vacuum works for their hair but like with hair it helps to spray it first. It did not come with a wall hanger like it says and the stand is inconvenient. The only reason why I wouldn’t buy it would be the it has to sit on a stand. Other than that it’s probably the most powerful hand vacuum I’ve used and seen available
customer_reviews.author: Sandie

customer_reviews.title: Great little vacuum for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We have all hardwood except a small area rug that sits partially underneath our couch. The rug is way too fluffy for our Roomba to go over it so we needed to find an alternative but felt getting a full-sized vacuum was unnecessary. This little vacuum does just the trick! It’s got great suction power, removes dog hair easily, and is lightweight. It’s also nice that it is cordless so we can easily use it in our car when needed. My only complaint is that the battery life is a little short (~30 minutes) but normally that isn’t an issue because the areas we use it on are quite small.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Wells

customer_reviews.title: Battery failed after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in late 2017 and it worked very well at first. However, in the short span of 8 months, the vacuum no longer holds a charge and it only works for 30 seconds at a time. I've seen similar reviews for this product and it does not appear to be a one-off issue. Unfortunately, there is no way to replace the battery and no support is offered for this product. I recommend purchasing a different handheld vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: scam
customer_reviews.text: Like every other B&D product we own, batteries are complete garbage and engineered to fail right after warranty and purposely made to be non-replaceable by simple means. B&D has earned a lifetime blacklist in our house, along with their crappier parent Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Best of the handhelds
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake a few years ago of buying a cheap version of this, a $30 Black and Decker, and everything that was wrong with it has been solved in this (twice as expensive) version--good suction, long lasting battery, no problem with getting it make contact with the charging plates which in that wall hung version frequently fell out of contact, and an LED light to show that it is charging. Sometimes you really do get what you pay for. The power cord from wall to charger is nice and long, even though the manufacturer's sketch makes it look like it's short. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: weissenkirchen

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Cordless Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: It works quite well. Good suction. Good battery life. On the downside it is very loud and I just don't know how long it will last. I've had cordless vacuums that worked great when relatively new but deteriorated within 6 months to a year. We'll see how long this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: mapell

customer_reviews.title: I have bought 2 of these and both have stopped working within a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to start, then 8 to 10 months later it would turn on and then turn off within a few seconds. I would turn the power switch off then turn it back on and then it would start again and then turn off. Seems like the motor overheats or something
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum worked fine for 28 months. Then the run time for with the battery fully charged dropped to one minute. The battery is not replaceable by the consumer. So, the product is now nearly useless. The idea of replacing a hand held vacuum every couple of years simply because it needs a new battery is absurd. To make this worse, proper disposal of the vacuum requires the consumer to open the unit and cut out the battery pack, which is hard-wired, i.e., soldered in.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a small Vacuum and a small apartment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little Dustbuster, was exactly what I was hoping for in a small vacuum. Has good suction and holds a decent charge, the charger itself is neat wherein its a contact charger so you just set it on a platform and it starts charging. My only complaint is the chamber for trash and such is hard to empty, and would be better served if it had multiple openings but instead you have to put your hand in there to pull out stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: A trooper
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing for a year and a half. I recently discovered that you're supposed to clean or replace the filter regularly. I've been using it regularly for 1.5 years before the suction went down enough for this to occur to me. It took a good while before my caveman brain even thought to empty it. What a trooper. This thing is my first line of defense against bugs and kitty litter. I would have died by now if it weren't for this handvac. Very easy to empty, no-plug charger is handy. Some people mentioned having problems with it, but I haven't had any in all this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I used this device to vaccum up some pretty fine dust, maybe the unit wasn't meant to clean every single type of dust..idk. but when i would start it up, it would shoot out a cloud of dust at me. I cleaned the whole thing, took everything apart per the user manual but still had some dust that would shoot out at me when i started the unit. i called customer support and they sent me a new one. it had been a little more than 1 year. because of that im giving them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand vac for limited use cases - non-replaceable battery pack
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years of use the battery pack has died. Won't run the vac for more than a minute anymore. It is very sad that the batteries can't be easily replaced - such a wast to trash the whole thing. It worked very well, had great suction and ran for a long time when the batteries were healthy. The only drawback is that it doesn't have any useful attachments. The narrow nozzle is all you get. Fine for small solid surfaces but not so great for larger areas or upholstery covered in pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: don_chuwish

customer_reviews.title: The charge holds.
customer_reviews.text: So many dust busters don't hold a charge for more than a few minutes no matter how long you charge the unit. This one is different. It's far superior and holds the charge for a lot longer. It is definitely bulkier than other dust busters but it's worth it to be able to use the unit for more than 2 minutes before it runs out of power. It also has great suction and an easy-to-remove waste bin to dump out the debris it picks up.
customer_reviews.author: diane w.

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and clean. It has good suction and I really like it for stairs. I have a cat and need to be cleaning up hair all the time. One great feature is the ability to extend the nozzle for hard to reach places.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann

customer_reviews.title: Pros - This has wonderful suction,
customer_reviews.text: Pros - This has wonderful suction, decent battery life, easy to open.... cons- base is a little awkward, and closing the wand is likely to result in pinching your finger...or maybe I just don't have the hang of it... Cons: Have had it 11 months, love it, but it has died. Guessing the battery? It still has a warranty so will see what happens if I take it to a dealer with the warranty. Called Stanley Black and Decker, because it is still under warranty they are sending me a replacement!! Can't wait to get it....just hope it works as well as this one did..
customer_reviews.author: Annes

customer_reviews.title: Fooled me twice — poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now purchased two of these units in the past four years. I bought the second unit to replace an identical unit that stopped working after about two years, when it would no longer recharge. The newer machine lasted less than two years. No matter how long it’s sat in the charger, it only works for about 60 seconds. Cleaning the vacuum per the instructions and replacing the filter makes no difference. I can only assume many, if not most, of the positive reviews here come from customers who’ve only owned this vacuum for a short time. Though it’s obviously not Dyson-level quality—or cost—this model isn’t cheap. It should last longer than 16 months.
customer_reviews.author: Irma Vep

customer_reviews.title: It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Dustbuster! Picks up fine pet hair like a dream. Pretty sure it’s the most powerful handheld vacuum I’ve ever had, I use it for all kinds of things. This is my first experience with this type of recharging station Ana I couldn’t be happier. I actually use it more often because I don’t have to plug it back in, I just set it down. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Becky Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Now I have 2 of these strong, long-lasting workhorses
customer_reviews.text: I have had another one of this same handheld cordless vacuum for several years. It's a workhorse. I've cleaned up after many home repair projects with wood chips from cutting boards, spackling dust from sanding walls, you name it. Also use it for edges and corners of carpeted stairs from time-to-time. It picks up almost anything and the charge lasts a long, long time. Finally decided to get one for downstairs just for convenience!
customer_reviews.author: AlanM

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one early in 2018. Loved it so much and bought another for my 2nd floor November of 2018. Both are still working great and I don’t know how I survived my my kids toddler years without it!! This gets used everyday in my home. We use it when we sweep up (no more dust pan) We use it at every litter box cleaning (twice a day) We use it to clean up my 3yr olds high chair after mealtimes. We use it for bathroom floor We use it to vacuum car To clean window sills, radiator covers The list goes on and on. Honestly if the battery goes bad soon; I would just buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Catt-Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than Red Devil dust buster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my worn out Red Devil dust buster and was surprised to find it much quieter and a better sucker. It is still noisy but quieter then RD. I use it more often because it is less clumsy than my old one. It has a heppa filter which does become plugged if you try to vacuum up flour or something really fine. It is a pain cleaning the filter so you learn not to use it for things like flour! there are 2 filters and you need to keep them clean for maximum power.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Jenson

customer_reviews.title: Buy hearing protection along with this item.
customer_reviews.text: It has sufficient suction for lots of uses and I would buy it again based on that one aspect. I thought that it came with a wall-mounting bracket when I bought it, but it doesn't, in fact, come with that bracket included. So make sure you either buy the wall-mounting bracket or have a flat surface where you can recharge this. Finally, it is so painfully loud when using that I employ my NHRA headphone-style hearing protectors when using this vacuum cleaner. It is unbelievably loud.
customer_reviews.author: priusgirl13

customer_reviews.title: Batteries lasted less than 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vac here on Amazon in Nov 2016 and in Sept 2018, the battery won't run longer than a minute. I'm not clear if I was supposed to leave the vac on the charger when unused or run it down and then charge it as I've read different things. Either way, it's disappointing it didn't make it two years and buying and replacing the battery costs more than buying a new vac.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor sucking power
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now and only get more disappointed with it every time I use it. I bought it to clean between couch cushions and to pick up dirt that I sweep up with a broom. It has hardly any power to pick up even small crumbs and it gets clogged or needs emptied in no time. The battery doesn't last for very long, but that isn't so much an issue for my use. Eventually I will replace it with a nicer product. Wish I hadn't bargain shopped because it has been a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but ok for now.
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace my hand-held Dyson, which sadly did not live very long. I am not thrilled; this machine is heavy for it’s size, quite loud and does not have the suction power that reviewers seemed to think. It does not do as good a job on the dog hair, not does the extension nozzle work very well. I’m not too thrilled with this purchase but will keep it until it breaks and rethink things 🤔
customer_reviews.author: MotherChickie

customer_reviews.title: Biggest waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it takes a while for it to fully charge, and I work in home security, so if ever I have to drill a door, I use the vacuum to clean up a mess. The run time on this thing is literally less than 15 minutes. And then on top of that, it fell down the stairs this morning, and it literally broke into pieces. The back plate, fell apart, and the clip that holds the plastic container, broke as well. This thing is literal trash.
customer_reviews.author: Laine Allemond

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SUCTION
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad Black & Decker changed to the Lithium batteries as their old style batteries would not last any time at all. This particular 16V Cordless Lithium dust buster is fantastic! It gets up kitty litter in a jiff and helps clean the lint screen on my dryer to perfection. It has a very strong suction and is LOUD so be aware of that. You don't want to use it when someone is asleep close by! Ha ha! My dogs and cats are now used to the loud noise this appliance makes so you'll get used to it too. I would highly recommend this dust buster...they also make one that is a 20V.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Butler

customer_reviews.title: Total waste after three years
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good cordless vac. Good power and run time UNTIL one or more of the lithium cells goes bad. Then it's so much more plastic waste in the landfill. I HATE that!! I'm pretty handy but Black and Decker has crafted this battery pack to be unrepairable by most everybody. I have tried contacting them numerous times to purchase a new battery pack - they will not reply to my inquiries so, I guess, they want us to throw them away. This designed garbage rubs me wrong. Consumers need to encourage better corporate behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Strong, lightweight and better battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of this lightweight handheld rechargeable BLACK+DECKER dustbuster. This is my second B & D product but this 16v has better suction. It is a tabletop recharging position which I am getting used to. My last one failed because it was always on the wall charger and weakened the battery. This one turns itself off after it is fully charged. Since it is cheaper to buy a new one than to replace the battery I did my research. This one was reasonably priced and rated at the top. It is well balanced and attractive. Great for crumbs on floor, workshops, pet hair, or car cleanups. Definitely makes clean-ups easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Menchetti

customer_reviews.title: JUST WHAT I WANTED
customer_reviews.text: There are two features I LOVE about this product. I love the easy stand set up. My last dust buster was an entire deal to make sure the device sat properly and the connection had to go into a certain hole- PAIN IN THE NECK. This vacuum just sits nicely on the stand without having to figure out how to do it. It is also lighter weight than my other and has a nice small brush attached that helps with steps. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Really my only complaint about this product is the really short amount of time it works after a full charge. I bought this because I have a vacuum with no attachments. Bad idea. This is probably meant for an every once in awhile use. Not too fast to charge, not long to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, good suction, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a small vacuum to keep near the cat food bowls and was happy to find that this model is still available because it can use the charger of the older one we already have. Works good for sucking up dry cat food, cat litter and cat hair. Just remember to clean the filter not just empty it out.
customer_reviews.author: Klaatu

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item, it was in the proper box but was taped shut excessively. When I took it out of the box, there was nothing in the box, no directions or any paperwork of any kind, just the sweeper. There was long dog hair all over the device. I ordered an unused product but clearly recieved a used one. Very unhappy and disappointed. And the product itself does not work well. Suction is disappointing. Uncertain if it would have been different had I recieved an unused product.
customer_reviews.author: jenn kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for a handheld vac
customer_reviews.text: I bought this new and improved version for downstairs to match the one upstairs. Works the same. The battery life is very good and it doesn’t die down slowly towards the end of the charge. The suction is better than other hand held ones we have had (especially the Dirt Devils, one on a cord, one not) and it works great on hardwood. It doesn’t “clean” anything. It picks up dry cat food bits, cereal that falls out of the box, and crumbs on a sofa cushion. On carpet, though, forget it. Buy a light vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCullers

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t like this vacuum. The suction on it is about zero. I bought it to use to vacuum my car. I ended up taking the mats out and sweeping them because this vacuum would not pick up anything. Even sand. I took my time and kept running over the mat but nothing was being picked up. No suction. Had I not thrown away the box before I even tried it (lesson learned) I would have returned it. It’s just sitting in my laundry room collecting dust. I haven’t been able to bring myself to throw it out yet. It’s brand new...just doesn’t seem right. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Patti S.

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and going strong! Best hand vac I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had many hand vacs over the years. Oh so many. And I probably chose this one because it’s blue 🙂 But 5 years ago I bought this model and it's by far the best one we’ve ever had. It sucks as it’s supposed to and it can sit off the charger for days on end and still have plenty of power. It’s very easy to take apart to empty and also clean the filter. After having it 5 years I have zero regrets. I’m finally buying some new filters because I never have and it deserves to have a new one. Black & Decker Dustbuster cordless handheld vacuum, long may he reign! (Hope I didn’t just jinx it lol)
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Runs about 30 seconds now before shutting down. Uses specialized Lithium batteries which are $25+ off ebay and require special welding to attach the contacts. OEM battery pack is not sold. I'm pretty good with electronics but kinda scared that if I order the batteries and screw up the welding I'll end up with a battery pack that lights itself on fire if it overheats. Disappointed in the useful life of this given the high price. I won't buy another Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: linuxgod

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn’t — warranty options made it difficult to coordinate fix.
customer_reviews.text: One day it was working great and then it stopped charging all together. Not a slow decline. No warning. One day it was sucking and the next day it just sucked. Now it just sits collecting the dust it should have been... collecting. The warranty to have it serviced would have taken us a half day to drop off and coordinate with the local “authorized repair shop.” And then covid happened and everything closed down and we were out off warranty. Obviously, black and decker can’t help that this administration couldn’t plan their way out of a paper bag. So the lapse in warranty is not B&Ds fault. Just unfortunate timing. The performance of the device. Well. That’s another question.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Battery
customer_reviews.text: I definitely should've read all the reviews about the battery before I purchased this. I've only had this for about 3 months now. I've used it maybe 4 times. I charge the battery completely each time, and can never use the vacuum but about 10-15 minutes before the battery is completely dead again (if that long!). Definitely do not recommend this product. I wish I had used it before my return period was over or I would've returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Clark

customer_reviews.title: WAY too loud!
customer_reviews.text: Decent vacuum overall, but I couldn't handle the noise. I read other reviews about the sound before buying, and shrugged them off with the assumption that some people will always find something wrong with everything. It's real folks- this thing is SO FREAKING LOUD. As soon as I turned it on I felt self conscious about the noise for the sake of the neighbors (I live in a townhouse). It felt rude to vacuum with this thing, it's that loud. Functionally it seemed fine. I wasn't too excited about the filter and how cumbersome it was to empty/clean. I sent it back, and wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TL;DR - It's not perfect, but it's good enough
customer_reviews.text: The bad: It's loud AF. The crevice tool doesn't lock well & slides back in when there is even light pressure on its end. The brush tool picks up debris but doesn't move the debris toward the nozzle to get vacuumed. The battery charge doesn't last long – you'd be lucky to get 10 minutes of use, 5-7 is more likely. The good: It's a handheld vacuum.... It has very good suction. It fulfills its purpose of quick and easy clean-up for small jobs. The rotating nozzle feature isn't designed in the best way, but it's still useful. The canister has a fairly large capacity. I like the "horizontal" charging plate instead of having to mount it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: kitefosta

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these that finally burned out after 10 years of solid use. I tried another brand made in China that did not work as well and had to return it. This model is a workhorse, just as effective as my old one. It has powerful suction and charges quickly, is easy to clean, and lightweight. I live with 3 cats who shed and a house full of plants and have a regular 2-year old visitor. This little vacuum handles whatever lands on the floor without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing a hand held vacuum. This particular one came up on all the ‘best’ lists. I am very disappointed. It has great sucking power but for a short amount of time. I had to completely disassemble and clean after only 1 use. It does not do well with any amount of pet hair. It’s really best for small spot clean ups. I really want to return it and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: MommyE

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Battery
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Battery We had such high hopes for this product after reading all the reviews. Turns out the "18 month" battery life that is advertised is 18 months until you have to replace the actual lithion ion battery. The battery, when fully charged, lasts only about 10 minutes total which makes this horribly useless when it comes to cleaning cars or stairs. It also seems that they expect you leave it on the charger at all times, I didn't want to have to leave this plugged in and out all the time. I was hoping for a unit that I could charge and put away, and then use when required to clean out the car or stairs. No such luck.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent H

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum...stupid charger.
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum, good suction, easy to clean out, seems like the filter will last a good long time. I had a similar Black & Decker model that lasted over eight years, lost it in the divorce. What a loss it was. There is no hanger/charger with this particular model. The charger is a disk that the vacuum sits upright on. Like I’m going to make this vacuum the centerpiece of my dining room table or something....kinda stupid charging system.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkon

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER dustbuster Handheld Vacuum, Cordless, 16V (CHV1410L)
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1BLACK + DECKER CHV1410L 16 volt Lithium Cordless Dust Buster Hand Vac Ideal for Any Quick Pick Up Ideal for Quick Pick Up The sleek CHV1410L boasts lithium technology, strong suction and fade free power. With a translucent bag less dirt bowl, the dirt is easy to see and empty. Ever ready, the hand vac can hold a charge for up to 18 months when off the charger, and is lightweight enough to tackle quick pick ups around the home. Smart Charge Technology High efficiency Lithium ion chargers help to protect your BLACK+DECKER hand vac by automatically shutting off when the battery is charged, allowing you to conveniently store your BLACK+DECKER hand vac on the charger while maintaining long run times, year after year. About Black + Decker Since 1910, Black + Decker has been setting the standard for innovation and design of power tools, accessories, outdoor yard care equipment, home cleaning products, automotive and lighting products, hardware and other home improvement products. The inventor of the first portable electric drill with pistol grip and trigger switch, Black + Decker has evolved from a small machine shop in Baltimore, Maryland to a global manufacturing and marketing powerhouse with a broad line of quality products used in and around the home and for commercial applications. When users need to get work done, they trust Black + Decker for the products that will do the job efficiently and reliably 16V MAX Lithium Ion Dust Buster 16V MAX Lithium Ion Dust buster This hand vac provides consumers with everything they need in a hand vac, plus long battery life, year after year. The CHV1410L features great power and suction for use on everything from carpet to ceramic tile to furniture and more. Cyclonic Action Cyclonic Action The cyclonic action spins dust and debris away from the filter keeping suction strong. It delivers powerful suction where users need it most. Crevice Tool and Brush. Note:Charging instructions can be seen in Page 4 to 5 and Direction for cleaning filters and canisters can be seen in Page 5 to 7 on Installation Manual available under technical specification. Charge Duration 4 hours Included Components: (1) CHV1410L hand vacuum, (1) Flip up brush, (1) Crevice tool, (1) Washable filter; Power Source: Cordless
feature_bullets: Lithium Ion for long battery life and outstanding performance; Always ready holds a charge for upto 18 months
Long life, Lightweight, and no memory effect.Suction Power 15.2 AW; Dustbowl Capacity: 20.6 ounces
Smart Charge Technology uses upto 50 percent less energy,air Watts: 15.2 Watts, Voltage: 16V MAX
Cyclonic action helps to keep the filter clean and power strong, translucent bagless dirt bowl easy to see dirt and empty
Rotating slim nozzle for a variety of applications, removable, washable bowl and filters for thorough cleaning
